intro: Exocarpos sparteus f. tenerior, commonly known as the soft-fruited hibiscus, is a unique variant of the species native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that turns red when mature, often containing several seeds. This plant thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden landscaping in warmer climates.
